  "description": "At ColaSolar, environmental responsibility is at the core of our operations. We provide clean, renewable solar energy systems that significantly reduce carbon emissions and support global climate change mitigation efforts. By adopting our solar solutions, customers actively participate in creating a more sustainable future while enjoying reliable power.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Solar Engineer / Technician
Job Location:&nbsp;Utako, Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Solar Engineer will support the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of solarsystems across residential, commercial, and industrial projects.
	This role offers a unique opportunity to work closely with seasoned engineers, gaining hands-on experience, technical expertise, and professional growth within the renewable energy sector.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in the design, planning, and analysis of solar PV systems (rooftop, ground-mounted, hybrid, and off-grid).
	Conduct load assessments, shading analysis, and system performance estimations.
	Support installation, commissioning, and routine maintenance of solar energy projects.
	Collaborate with senior engineers to troubleshoot technical issues and optimize system performance.
	Participate in site surveys, prepare engineering documentation, and contribute to project reports.
	Ensure compliance with safety standards, environmental regulations, and company policies.
	Learn directly from experienced engineers through mentorship, shadowing, and technical training.
	Stay up to date on industry advancements, equipment, and innovative solar solutions.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	B.Sc ./ B.Eng. in Electrical Engineering, Renewable Energy, Mechanical Engineering, or related discipline.
	1 &ndash; 3 years of relevant experience in solar systems (graduates with internship/NYSC experience may also apply).
	Solid understanding of electrical systems, renewable energy concepts, and safety regulations.
	Proficiency in solar design tools/software (e.g., PVsyst, Helioscope, AutoCAD) is an added advantage.
	Strong problem-solving, analytical, and teamwork skills.
	Willingness to learn and grow under mentorship from experienced engineers.
	Excellent communication and reporting skills.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary (N100,000 - N200,000 / month) and benefits package.
	Structured mentorship and knowledge transfer from senior engineers.
	Hands-on experience with diverse solar projects.
	Clear opportunities for career progression and professional development.
	A supportive and innovative work environment in the renewable energy industry.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter&nbsp;to:&nbsp;hr@colasolar.com&nbsp;using &quot;Application &ndash; Solar Engineer / Technician&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

        At ColaSolar, environmental responsibility is at the core of our operations. We provide clean, renewable solar energy systems that significantly reduce carbon emissions and support global climate change mitigation efforts. By adopting our solar solutions, customers actively participate in creating a more sustainable future while enjoying reliable power.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Solar Engineer / Technician
Job Location: Utako, Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description

	The Solar Engineer will support the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of solarsystems across residential, commercial, and industrial projects.
	This role offers a unique opportunity to work closely with seasoned engineers, gaining hands-on experience, technical expertise, and professional growth within the renewable energy sector.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in the design, planning, and analysis of solar PV systems (rooftop, ground-mounted, hybrid, and off-grid).
	Conduct load assessments, shading analysis, and system performance estimations.
	Support installation, commissioning, and routine maintenance of solar energy projects.
	Collaborate with senior engineers to troubleshoot technical issues and optimize system performance.
	Participate in site surveys, prepare engineering documentation, and contribute to project reports.
	Ensure compliance with safety standards, environmental regulations, and company policies.
	Learn directly from experienced engineers through mentorship, shadowing, and technical training.
	Stay up to date on industry advancements, equipment, and innovative solar solutions.


Qualifications & Skills


	B.Sc ./ B.Eng. in Electrical Engineering, Renewable Energy, Mechanical Engineering, or related discipline.
	1 – 3 years of relevant experience in solar systems (graduates with internship/NYSC experience may also apply).
	Solid understanding of electrical systems, renewable energy concepts, and safety regulations.
	Proficiency in solar design tools/software (e.g., PVsyst, Helioscope, AutoCAD) is an added advantage.
	Strong problem-solving, analytical, and teamwork skills.
	Willingness to learn and grow under mentorship from experienced engineers.
	Excellent communication and reporting skills.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary (N100,000 - N200,000 / month) and benefits package.
	Structured mentorship and knowledge transfer from senior engineers.
	Hands-on experience with diverse solar projects.
	Clear opportunities for career progression and professional development.
	A supportive and innovative work environment in the renewable energy industry.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: hr@colasolar.com using "Application – Solar Engineer / Technician" as the subject of the mail.

  "description": "BridgeHR Consulting Services - Our client, a reputable growing company in Ajao Estate,&nbsp;is recruiting highly competent and detail-oriented candidates&nbsp;to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Ajao Estate,&nbsp; Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Style: Onsite (8:00am &ndash; 5:30pm)

Summary


	This role requires a mature, analytical, and proactive professional with solid technical accounting skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare and maintain accurate financial records.
	Handle VAT, WHT, PAYE, and other statutory remittances.
	Manage payroll processing and staff deductions.
	Perform bank reconciliations and manage cash flow records.
	Prepare monthly and quarterly management accounts.
	Use accounting software (QuickBooks, Sage, etc.) efficiently.
	Support audits and ensure compliance with accounting standards.
	Provide financial reports and analysis to management for decision-making.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	3&ndash;5 years of experience in a similar role.
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACA, ACCA) is an added advantage.
	Strong proficiency in Excel (lookup functions, pivot tables, analysis).
	Solid experience with VAT, WHT, PAYE, payroll, and bank reconciliation.
	Excellent attention to detail, integrity, communication, and analytical skills.
	Leadership ability and professional maturity.


Salary &amp; Benefits


	N200,000 &ndash; N250,000 monthly (can go up to N300,000 for exceptional candidates).
	Opportunity for growth within a structured environment.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;bridgehr2024@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Accountant &ndash; Ajao Estate&quot; as the subject of the email.

Accountant Job at BridgeHR Consulting Services




        
    

        
        BridgeHR Consulting Services - Our client, a reputable growing company in Ajao Estate, is recruiting highly competent and detail-oriented candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Ajao Estate,  Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Style: Onsite (8:00am – 5:30pm)

Summary


	This role requires a mature, analytical, and proactive professional with solid technical accounting skills.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Prepare and maintain accurate financial records.
	Handle VAT, WHT, PAYE, and other statutory remittances.
	Manage payroll processing and staff deductions.
	Perform bank reconciliations and manage cash flow records.
	Prepare monthly and quarterly management accounts.
	Use accounting software (QuickBooks, Sage, etc.) efficiently.
	Support audits and ensure compliance with accounting standards.
	Provide financial reports and analysis to management for decision-making.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	3–5 years of experience in a similar role.
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACA, ACCA) is an added advantage.
	Strong proficiency in Excel (lookup functions, pivot tables, analysis).
	Solid experience with VAT, WHT, PAYE, payroll, and bank reconciliation.
	Excellent attention to detail, integrity, communication, and analytical skills.
	Leadership ability and professional maturity.


Salary & Benefits


	N200,000 – N250,000 monthly (can go up to N300,000 for exceptional candidates).
	Opportunity for growth within a structured environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: bridgehr2024@gmail.com using "Accountant – Ajao Estate" as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
